meanings.definition: To fill with consternation or dismay.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm appalls my little sister.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected news appalls the entire community.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs appalls most people.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence of the abandoned house appalls me.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the ghostly figure appalls the brave knight.

meanings.definition: To overcome with horror or fear.
meanings.sent1: The horror movie appalls young children.
meanings.sent2: The dark forest appalls hikers at night.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a clown party appalls some people.
meanings.sent4: The haunted house story appalls the curious teenagers.
meanings.sent5: The sudden appearance of a ghost appalls the unsuspecting travelers.

meanings.definition: To cause to feel extreme disgust or revulsion.
meanings.sent1: The rotten smell of the garbage appalls the neighbors.
meanings.sent2: The gruesome scene in the movie appalls sensitive viewers.
meanings.sent3: The thought of eating snails appalls my friend.
meanings.sent4: The sight of the decaying carcass appalls the wildlife photographer.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the spoiled milk appalls the restaurant patrons.
